cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (forecast to become Category 1 before landfall)
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, expected to cross Florida’s Big Bend tonight then track northeast along/near the Southeast U.S. coast and move offshore of the Carolinas late Friday-Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near the Suwannee River / Keaton Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet NC (Pamlico Sound)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC; Hurricane Warning Suwannee River FL to Mexico Beach FL (Gulf side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast Big Bend tonight, then Atlantic coast from northeast FL through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic through Saturday–Sunday
weather_observation.wind: Bands could bring gusts 25–40 mph Friday; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are improbable (≤14% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along the east-central Florida coast during Friday high-tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain in squalls Friday, locally higher in heavier bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and short-term berth roll as outer squalls pass.
